summary: You asked for it, then you have it. Tamriel Reloaded get better trees. All trees remade, many new and more tree variety.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/58478-1-1412026802.jpg[/img]

[center][youtube]_EznJYyypR8[/youtube][youtube]JKgX1EpV_BI[/youtube][/center]

Complete rework of Skyrim trees making Tamriel less boring to explore. It changes some tree spots to make more variety. It also add hand places trees for all over the map. The trees are:
Mapples, Pines, cherry blossom, cypress, weeping trees, dead trees..

[size=2][b][color=orange]UPDATES:[/color][/b][/size]
-01-05-15: Added many tree spots, specially in the tundra zone. New trees for some forest zones: pinewatch, south of Ivarstead, near Autumnshade Clearing, west fort Snowhawk, near Roadside ruins and some more i forgot. Also new trees are added and some olf textures are fixed like blossom, mapple and aspen (more red leaves) and new pine textures.

[size=2][b][color=orange]Where are the trees?.[/color][/b][/size]
I did so many changes i dont remember all but some places to check:

-Hunters rest to north-east road to Half-Moon mill.

-Whiterun entrance and honningbrew Meadery.

-Riverwood south-west, road with 2 pine spots in the other side of the river near riverwood and another in front of guardian stone.

-Riften south gate and around the lake some mapple spots.

-Some spots around Ivarstead

-Darkwater Crossing

-Markarth entrance


[size=3][b][color=orange]INSTALLATION[/color][/b][/size]

[size=4][b][color=red]1[/color][/b][/size]- Download the files you want and install via NMM or copying content into Skyrim/data folder and click "yes" when prompted.
[size=4][b][color=red]2[/color][/b][/size]- Activate the .esp file in NMM.
[size=4][b][color=red]3[/color][/b][/size]- If you want to use any optional file, chose the file and install via NMM or copying content into Skyrim/data folder and click "yes" when prompted.

[size=2][b][color=orange]Compatibility[/color][/b][/size]
The hand places trees can conflict with house mods or any mod that place something somewhere. Tress can be deleted by CK or by Tesvedit

[size=2][b][color=orange]Load order[/color][/b][/size]
Not much important.

[size=2][b][color=orange]ENBs[/color][/b][/size]
For the pics i used last version of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49834/?]Tamriel Reloaded ENB[/url].

[size=2][b][color=orange]FPS[/color][/b][/size]
There are some places where trees eat little fps.

[size=2][b][color=orange]Recomended mods:[/color][/b][/size]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel 3.1[/url] (i like more than pureweather)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39799/?]Climates Of Tamriel - Weather Patch[/url] (use volumetric fog only if you have good gaming pc)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46925/?]Tamriel Reloaded - Textures and Parallax[/url]

[size=2][b][color=red]If you dont like some trees or have conflict with other mod[/color][/b][/size]
You can delete them via CK or just delete the block where they are in tesvedit. To know which block to delete see mod in credits.
Other easy and faster fix (sugested by user arahat): [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/1111601-using-the-console-to-remove-trees-in-game/]http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/1111601-using-the-console-to-remove-trees-in-game/[/url]

[size=2][b][color=green]Credits[/color][/b][/size]
This mod would not be possible without [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19268/?]GKB Green Trees[/url] from Ga-Knomboe Boy.

I also used a lot [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2251/?]SK-TamrielWordspaceModdersMaps[/url] from worm82075.
